components.description:
Meow! A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a cat, looking straight ahead. Generally depicted as a yellowish-orange cat face with pointed ears and whiskers.

May be used with a more affectionate tone than the full-bodied ğŸˆ Cat, though their applications generally overlap.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Vendors implement the same or similar cat in their ğŸˆ Cat as well as in their cat-faced variants of smileys:

  • ğŸ˜¼ Cat Face With Wry Smile
  • ğŸ˜¹ Cat Face With Tears of Joy
  • ğŸ™€ Weary Cat Face
  • ğŸ˜¾ Pouting Cat Face
  • ğŸ˜¿ Crying Cat Face
  • ğŸ˜» Smiling Cat Face With Heart-Eyes
  • ğŸ˜º Grinning Cat Face
  • ğŸ˜¸ Grinning Cat Face With Smiling Eyes
  • ğŸ˜½ Kissing Cat Face

Google’s cat face was previously orange, Samsung’s gray, and Facebook’s once gray and white. Included in the earliest Japanese emoji sets from Softbank, Docomo, and au by KDDI.

title: Cat Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.
